reviews.review:
Захватывающее продолжение легендарной игровой вселенной [b] Half Life [/b], в котором всё тот же самый отважный, находчивый и целеустремлённый [i] Гордон Фримен [/i] борется со злом ради спасения человечества. Эпизод Два преподносит игрокам интересное продолжение с неожиданными поворотами событий. Главный герой игры вместе со своей храброй напарницей [i] Аликс Венс [/i] пытаются выполнить важное задание, порученное отрядами Сопротивления, а также учёными [b] «Чёрной Мезы» [/b]. Цель: добраться до Белой Рощи - главной базы Сопротивления и передать повстанцам захваченные в первом эпизоде ([b] Half-Life 2: Episode One [/b]) секретные данные Альянса. Как жаль, что главные герои не ожидали к чему всё это приведёт... Всем рекомендую пройти, если этого не сделали ранее !
[b]Сюжет[/b] - 9/10
[b]Графика[/b] - 9/10
[b]Геймплей[/b] - 10/10
[b]Атмосфера[/b] - 9/10
Средний балл  -  9

[h1]Half-Life 2: Episode Two[/h1]
Skvělý zážitek ...  Máte zde spoustu nového obsahu a příběh je mnohem lepší než u episody one. Hudba taky samozřejmě skvělá a prostředí lesa a dolů je taky dobře zpracované. Příběh jsem si užil ale ne asi tolik jako u originálního Half-Life 2. Konec je velmi otevřený a já se tak můžu připojit k dalším milionům hráčům kteří čekají na Half-Life 3.

+Konec 
+Hudba
+Příběh
+Nový obsah

- Opět kratší než originál

Second episode of the epic HL2.
Story of the Gordon Freeman continues somewhere outside city 17.
In my honest opinion this episode is my favourite, because the 
emotion and impact that this part of the story has is really something
that will give you shivers in the end...

Graphics are updated even more than before,
you drive a cool car through a good part of the game,
there are few type of new enemies and there's nothing much
more to say about it.

I am still hoping for the HL3 or EP3.....
This one is definetly worth the price. Buy it, Play it.
Cry for some more after it...

Just as good as it's been built up to be over the years with some of the most creative and fun combat encounters in the entire series. This final episode feels like a mix of the more gameplay focused base half life 2 while still retaining the more cinematic narrative edge which episode 1 brought along with it. An absolutely amazing conclusion to one of the very best game series around. Just please make episode 3 already valve.

You're welcome.

If you are going to play any of Half-Life 2, HL2: Episode 1, and/or Episode 2, you should really play all three in order.  Episode 2 gets back to the gun play and crazy intense fights that I felt were a bit left out of Episode 1.  You have at least two large battles where you are defending a location, especially a fun one where you are ducking in and out of rooms fighting a new robotic enemy that you will grow to fear.  There is also a chase sequence through an cave complex that reminded me of my time creeping through Black Mesa's Xen.

The two big issues I heard before playing this game was the final battle, and the lack of follow up for the ending.  Alas, I can't disagree with the ending issues.  There are all sorts of juicy ideas thrown out in the latter third of the game that would make a new Half-Life game interesting.  The final battle is imposing if you don't know the better approaches to the fight.  I don't agree with the reliance on a skill that wasn't that important for the entirety of Episode 2, namely driving, for the final battle.  It IS doable though.  I beat it on normal with only one death that was more bad luck than anything, but that was with some idea of a good approach.  So try it awhile and if you hit a wall, watch someone play it, get some tips, and then try again.

Play it and understand the memes.

This game had a much better pace than the main half-life 2 game. It was the right length and that is a big reason why I enjoyed it more. It also had more story than its predecessor which is a plus.
Epic

this episode is amazing. it takes what half life 2 does so well, and expands on it, adding awesome new things to do. it makes new, exiting, and memorable chapters that in concept alone seem like something in a movie. it feels less like it's relying on the physics engine and letting you do things how you want. That creativity and freedom is still there, but the game makes you feel like you are in a fucking action movie. it gives you freedom, but feels more like a dynamic, lived in world than a sandbox. It has an amazing plot continuation that keeps you on the edge of your seat and throws curveballs at you. play this damn game. you will not regret it

Half-Life 2: Episode Two is more of the same HL2 core gameplay, following directly from the end of Episode One. I found the first couple chapters in the caves a little on the weaker side, but after getting through that, this is Half-Life at its best, with some of the best set piece firefights in the entire series. There's not much more to say; the game has more of the great environments, level design, and solid mechanics that you would expect from the series.

On the other hand, while Half-Life 2: Episode Two is a great game, the big cliffhanger ending can feel a little unsatisfying, knowing that we never got a proper continuation. Maybe Half-Life: Alyx clears some things up, but considering the high barrier of entry of VR, this is still the ending of the series for most people. I hope we get a proper conclusion someday, but even without it, HL2:E2 is still highly recommended.

This game is fucking awesome.

It expands on every aspect of Half-Life 2 in every way. I was super worried going in because of how much I hated episode one but this went above and beyond. Its story grabbed my heart in a very strange way I wasn't expecting, almost bringing me to tears at the ending. After playing this game I can fully understand the Half-Life "craze". 

Although it will never happen, the idea of episode three will live on in my heart.
